basics.name: Lucas MacQuarrie
basics.label: Master's Student in Applied Mathematics
basics.summary: Lucas MacQuarrie from PEI at KAIST

work.name: Pied Piper
work.summary: Pied Piper is a multi-platform technology based on a proprietary universal compression algorithm that has consistently fielded high Weisman Scores™ that are not merely competitive, but approach the theoretical limit of lossless compression.
highlights: Build an algorithm for artist to detect if their music was violating copy right infringement laws
Successfully won Techcrunch Disrupt
Optimized an algorithm that holds the current world record for Weisman Scores

researchExperience.title: Graduate Student
researchExperience.summary: I am currently a master’s student under Dr. CheolWoo Park, looking for ways to solve problems in analyzing compositional data. At the moment, I am using biological information to improve the analysis of microbiome data, building off work by a previous postdoc, Dr. Junyoung Park.
highlights: Independently created project proposals for conducting new research
Regularly search research journals for new techniques to apply to both simulated and experimental data sets using Python

researchExperience.title: Research Intern
researchExperience.summary: The quasi-steady state approximation (QSSA) has long been used to approximate systems of differential equations, especially in mathematical biology and systems biology. I investigated the effects of adding noise to the QSSA and its accuracy in simulating biological systems.
highlights: Reformulated and analyzed a known model by Dr. Euimin Jeong in deterministic and stochastic settings using analytical techniques and Python simulations.
Implemented the Gillespie algorithm to evaluate noise impact on mRNA production during DNA replication.
Participated in Peer Review by reviewing and providing feedback to unpublished research in mathematical biology
Compiled project work and code into documentation for incoming interns.
Presented a journal talk on neural networks and flow map ideas for learning system dynamics from data.
Developed professional relationships within the mathematical biology community at the Society of Mathematical Biology annual conference and within the lab.

researchExperience.title: Research Assistant (NSERC USRA)
researchExperience.summary: Previous work conjectured simple conditions for the mathematically complicated Recurrence phenomenon in systems of differential equations. We found numerous counter examples providing deeper insight into the natural of recurrence and conjectured new conditions for it's existence.
highlights: Independently and successfully conducted research from home (1800km distance from supervisor)
Extensively used iPynotebooks for explaining and simulating ODE models with Python.
Analyzed ODE models using MatCont to perform bifurcation analysis.
Drafted a research paper for publication with Dr. Pei Yu.

researchExperience.title: Research Assistant | Optimization, LaTeX Formatting
researchExperience.description: Working on a short-term project with Dr. Kakeu to produce documents and code using LaTeX, investigate formulas for Truncated Univariate Normal Distributions, and create interactive Mathematica notebooks.
highlights: Produced LaTeX documents and formatted large reports.
Developed interactive Mathematica notebooks for research optimization.
Wrote reports on my findings in LaTeX to be presented in meetings Collaborated in meetings.

researchExperience.title: Research Assistant
researchExperience.supervisor: Dr. Nasser Saad, Dr. Shafiqul Islam
researchExperience.summary: Extended the Asymptotic Iteration Method (AIM) for solving second-order linear homogeneous ODEs to the Hahn operator.
highlights: Presented results at the Canadian Undergraduate Mathematics Conference.
Published work in Advances in Difference Equations, 2021.
Held weekly meetings for presenting and discussing work.
Used Mathematica, Maple, Matlab, Python, and LaTeX for symbolic computations.

researchExperience.title: Research Assistant (NSERC USRA)
researchExperience.supervisor: Dr. Nasser Saad, Dr. Shafiqul Islam
researchExperience.summary: Supported the formation of a mathematical oncology research group at UPEI and analyzed models of cancer growth and treatment.
highlights: Conducted literature reviews and self-taught methodologies in mathematical oncology.
Simulated differential equation models in oncology and competing populations with Python.
Attended conferences, workshops, and summer courses to deepen understanding of nonlinear dynamics and cancer research.
Presented research at Science Atlantic and Society of Mathematical Biology conferences.

teachingExperience.institution: Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology
teachingExperience.description: I created interesting and relevant weekly lectures for Calculus 1 (MAS 101B). I consistently received good feedback and questions from students, even having students from other sections sneak into my lectures to hear them. I also marked exams, assignments, and proctored exams for this course.
highlights: Marked assignments and exams for the course.
Proctored exams for the course.

teachingExperience.institution: UPEI Math Department, UPEI Residence, IB High School Writing Center, Western Tutor Bank
teachingExperience.description: Tutored many students in various subjects at the undergraduate and high school levels. Participated in multiple tutoring groups including UPEI's Math and Computer Science Help Center and residence tutoring at UPEI. I am currently on break to focus on research.
highlights: Provided private tutoring both online and in person.
Assisted students in subjects ranging from mathematics, statistics, computer science, chemistry, and writing.

teachingExperience.description: Marking exams and assignments for Differential Calculus (CALC 1000B). I also proctored exams for this course.
highlights: Marked assignments and exams for the course.
Proctored exams for the course.

teachingExperience.description: Marking exams and assignments for Differential Calculus (CALC 1000B). I also proctored exams for this course.
highlights: Marked assignments and exams for the course.
Proctored exams for the course.

teachingExperience.description: Assisted in teaching Calculus I by running tutorials, answering student questions, and delivering mini lectures. Also proctored tests for the course.
highlights: Ran weekly tutorials for Calculus I students explaining concepts and answering questions.
Proctored tests and provided additional instruction during office hours.

communityInvolvement.description: Rebuilt the Mathematics Club at Western after its dissolution and led it as president during the 2022-2023 academic year.
highlights: Successfully organized a cross-campus bar night in collaboration with a local club.
Collaborated with the biology department to host nature walks and garbage clean-ups.
Planned and hosted a student led seminar on mathematics.

communityInvolvement.description: Founding member and secretary for AWM, contributing to meeting organization, event planning, and outreach.
highlights: Organized a generative art tutorial teaching Processing programming language.
Collaborated on a blog post explaining strange attractors.
Conducted outreach programs for local high schools.
Hosted a headshot event offering free professional photos to students.

communityInvolvement.location: University of Prince Edward Island, Charlottetown, PEI
communityInvolvement.description: Organized activities and helped international students improve their English and integrate into UPEI's academic community.
highlights: Prepared and ran weekly social and academic events.
Planned and hosted exchange student group activities.
Conducted surveys on online learning effectiveness and prepared reports and infographics.
Assisted in delivering a Professional Communications Course for mature students.

communityInvolvement.organization: UPEI Buddy Program and Language Exchange Program
communityInvolvement.location: University of Prince Edward Island, Charlottetown, PEI
communityInvolvement.description: Participated in and later organized programs pairing PEI and international students to foster language learning and cultural exchange.
highlights: Helped international students become accustomed to life in PEI.
Organized the Language Exchange Program in Fall 2020 alongside a coworker.

communityInvolvement.description: Translated the Gnuastro manual and website into French, contributing to an official GNU software package for astronomy.
highlights: Collaborated with international programmers via git and email.
Ensured documents were formatted and uploaded correctly.
Supported the free software movement by contributing to open-source documentation.

publications.title: Asymptotic iteration method for solving Hahn difference equations
publications.summary: Hahn’s difference operator is used to unify the recently established difference and q-asymptotic iteration methods (DAIM, qAIM). The technique is applied to solve the second-order linear Hahn difference equations. The necessary and sufficient conditions for polynomial solutions are derived and examined for the (q;w)-hypergeometric equation.

presentations.title: Data driven governing equations approximation using deep neural networks
presentations.event: IBS Journal Club, INSTITUTE FOR BASIC SCIENCE
presentations.description: A PowerPoint presentation discussing recent work by Professor Dongbin Xiu’s group at Ohio State University in the area of flow map learning, with applications to microbiome data analysis.
highlights: Introduced neural network flow map learning
Applied algorithms to research on microbiome data

presentations.title: The Asymptotic Iteration Method and Hahn Difference Equations
presentations.description: A 40-minute chalk-talk on the Asymptotic Iteration Method, its applications, and its generalization to difference equations and Hahn operators.
highlights: Discussed extensions of Asymptotic Iteration Method
Explored open problems for eigenvalue algorithms

presentations.title: The Asymptotic Iteration Method: A Method to Solve Certain 2nd Order Linear Homogeneous ODEs with Functional Coefficients and Related Topics
presentations.description: 45-minute talk on solving second-order linear ODEs using the Asymptotic Iteration Method, including its generalization to different operators and challenges.
highlights: Introduced Asymptotic Iteration Method
Explored generalizations and limitations

presentations.title: qwAim: The Asymptotic Iteration Method (AIM) Generalized
presentations.description: Talk and poster on the extension of the Asymptotic Iteration Method to Hanh operators, with applications to q-difference equations.
highlights: Discussed AIM extensions to Hanh operators
Introduced q-series and its applications

presentations.title: A Soft Introduction to q-Series
presentations.description: Short introductory talk on q-series, their applications, and the solution of basic q-difference equations.
highlights: Explained basic q-analogues
Proved the q-binomial theorem

presentations.title: Asymptotic Iteration Method for the Hahn Difference Equations
presentations.description: Presentation on the Hahn difference operator and its application to the Asymptotic Iteration Method, leading to polynomial solutions for certain equations.
highlights: Introduced Hahn difference operator
Solved second-order linear Hahn difference equations

presentations.title: q,w-AIM for the Second Order Linear Difference Equation
presentations.description: Poster presentation on extending the Asymptotic Iteration Method to Hahn differential operators, including solution conditions and examples.
highlights: Presented results of AIM extension to Hahn operator
Explained solution conditions and provided examples

presentations.title: Sudden Cardiac Death, a Problem in Topology
presentations.description: Presentation of a paper exploring the connection between topology and biological systems, particularly sudden cardiac death.
highlights: Shared mathematical and biological connections
Discussed interdisciplinary approach

presentations.title: An Introduction to Mathematical Biology and Modelling of Tumour Growth
presentations.description: Talk on cancer modeling and simulation methodologies, with a focus on radiotherapy sequencing research.
highlights: Presented cancer growth modeling methodologies
Discussed radiotherapy sequencing research

presentations.title: Understanding Cancer using Mathematical Modeling
presentations.description: Poster presentation on current research methodologies in mathematical modeling of cancer and related biological systems.
highlights: Presented on mathematical oncology research
Showcased current work in cancer modeling

projects.name: This website!
projects.description: I made this website in an effort to organize my professional portfolio and create web apps for students. Throughout my career I have had to remake basic applications from scratch because current ones don't do exactly what I would like. I wanted to find a way to make these applications available to everyone without downloading an executable, so I began to learn to make websites.
highlights: I learned to make websites using Django and style them with tailwindCSS. On top of html, CSS, and Javascript,
Used basic SQL and json to organize content for rendering
Using modern technologies such as GoogleMaps, Chrome Extension and Javascript
